MR No. 314 - Unique E. G. White Expressions

     Matters must be so arranged that canvassers shall have enough to live on without overdrawing. This door of temptation must be closed and barred. However honest a canvasser may be, circumstances will arise in his work which will be a sore temptation to him. Let the barn be locked before the horse is stolen. This is the best way.--Letter 10, 1901, pp. 1, 2. (To E. R. Palmer, January 21, 1901.)
